entry.title: Gravity
entry.summary:
Author: Artsy_Latina

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,484Chapters: 11/11Kudos: 150

Summary: Bruce Wayne lives by one rule: no romantic relationships. It keeps his head clear, his life peaceful, and his crime fighting much easier. Yet he can't help but find himself wrapped up in a Metropolis reporter. Clark Kent. The man of Bruce's dream and his one pain in the ass. With his double life dating is nearly impossible and no matter how much Bruce pushes away. Kent always comes back.

entry.title: Only yours
entry.summary:
Author: Speechless_since_1998

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,257Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 92

Summary: "Bruce...your heart. It's racing." Bruce gritted his teeth, refusing to acknowledge the way Clark's words vibrated against his cheekbone where it was pressed into the alien's stupidly firm pectorals. "Situation's tense," he muttered, voice muffled against Kryptonian muscle. "Stay still." But Clark shifted, deliberately leaning forward until Bruce's nose was crushed against the seam of his suit, the heat of him overwhelming, the scent of ozone and sunlight trapped in fabric filling Bruce's lungs. His hands flexed against Clark’s sides, leather gloves creaking with the strain of not gripping hard enough to bruise. "You’re doing this on purpose," Bruce snarled, tipping his head back to glare, only for Clark to smirk down at him, blue eyes crinkled at the corners like this was funny, like Bruce wasn't one accidental rub away from disgrace. "Doing what?" Clark asked, all innocence, and Bruce snarled, twisting his hips back to put distance between them, only for thick vines overhead to tighten in warning, thorns grazing his neck. (In which Bruce is stuck in a situation because of Zatanna, and Clark is having the time of his life...)

entry.title: I Know You’re Tired, Well I’m Tired Too
entry.summary:
Author: Kingiic

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,778Chapters: 5/30Kudos: 9

Summary: Light, all consuming and wet. The chords of blackness receded from the peripherals of his vision. Nothing remained of the evidence. The beast from seconds ago was nothing more than a literal stain on Gordon’s white button up. And Light; totally absolute in its buzzing heat. Gordon lifted his arm to shield his eyes from the beams. In an instant, the light dulled. Gordon took a moment to rub his eyes and readjust himself before looking at the six-foot bat signal pointing directly at him. Perched on the metal neck, standing just behind the dimmed light, stood the half-illuminated silhouette of the Batman. “We need to talk.” Began the familiar voice, low and stern. “Are you functional?” ______________ Someone is making clones of this world’s most powerful individuals, Gotham is battling fascism and corruption in the midst of a mayoral race, and Batman must learn how to fight fire with fire, or else he'll have to make a few new friends.

entry.title: And you can quote me on that
entry.summary:
Author: maruja35

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,543Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Clark nods, pushes his glasses back into place, smiles. It's sweet. It's comfortable. Bruce feels a sense of peace — there's no need to rush this. He steals one last kiss, then walks back to his car. He remembers to text Clark later, when he's back at the manor and before patrol, letting him know he made it home safe and wishing him a good night. He sees Clark again, unplanned, unexpected, Saturday night. Or After the Rift, Clark keeps moving. He's a bit lonely, a bit less trusted than he was before, a bit optimistic about a budding new friendship - relationship? He's determined not to mess things up, but he will. Things never work out just right. Meanwhile, Bruce throws caution to the wind and lets someone in for a change. He thinks it's fine, until he makes eye contact with him from across the room and feels the cool knife of betrayal slide between his ribs. It only gets more complicated from there.

entry.title: Between Being and Pretending
entry.summary:
Author: mysspacemar

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,943Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 7

Summary: Bruce Wayne learned early how to live behind masks—some made of silence, others of control.Clark Kent, on the other hand, spent his life trying to fit into spaces far too small for who he truly was.In a Gotham built on restrained encounters, old friendships, and unspoken truths, they grow closer with caution, stumbling over what they feel and what they hide.Because sometimes, loving someone isn’t about revealing who you are, but about being seen even while pretending.

entry.title: rainy days
entry.summary:
Author: mikaminato

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 89,508Chapters: 8/8Kudos: 5,145

Summary: "So, maybe you've found your home here in Gotham. At least it's not that far, compared to Kansas." Bruce's voice is smooth and steady, his tone low.It's hard to keep a straight face at that.Clark's lips curve into a fond smile as he chuckles and shakes his head, leaning back against his seat, a hand rubbing across the nape of his neck."Yeah. Maybe I have. The coffee's great here. And the company is really nice." Clark offers a smile as he meets Bruce's eyes, holding his gaze for a beat too long before returning it to his pie.He doesn't miss the way Bruce's heart rate stutters at his comment.--Or, Clark Kent can't do one night stands, and Bruce is just his usual human disaster.(This story officially ends at Chapter 5.Everything after that will be extra chapters, which I'll post whenever I feel like it!)

entry.title: Turn This Manor into a Home!
entry.summary:
Author: jerrys_21_sided_die

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,467Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: For as long as Bruce can (or chooses) to remember, Wayne Manor has been empty. After Alfred gets fed up with his macho “I’m Batman I don’t need anyone but the night.” attitude he sends Bruce to Haly’s circus to unwind; but thats not what happens, Bruce watches two performers fall to their deaths as their 7 year old son watches. Bruce decides right there and then he won’t let Richard become one of the children lost to Gothams foster care system. Along the way a reporter from the Daily Planet catches wind of this ordeal, as he interviews Richard (with the help of Bruce) he starts to linger more and more around Wayne Manor. As introverted as Bruce is, he likes the reporters company, Richard’s little feet pattering around the manor, and the dinner outings the trio go on every Friday. They make this house (or mansion) a home.

entry.title: The Way You Bruise
entry.summary:
Author: AllandBeyond

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 121,362Chapters: 19/30Kudos: 165

Summary: Clark Kent is convinced Bruce Wayne is nothing more than a spoiled rich kid, while Bruce is certain Clark is an irritating journalist who cannot mind his own business. They tell themselves they hate each other, but a single reckless kiss at a party leaves them tangled in something far more complicated. Now every fight feels like a challenge, every bruise feels like a reminder, and neither of them is ready to admit that hate might not be the only thing keeping them up at night.
